content: What ancient civilization built the famous pyramids at Giza, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu?

The ancient civilization that built the famous pyramids at Giza, including the Great Pyramid of Khufu, was the Old Kingdom of Ancient Egypt. The pyramids were constructed as tombs for pharaohs and their consorts during the Fourth Dynasty, around 2580-2560 BC. The Great Pyramid of Khufu is the largest and most famous of the three pyramids in the Giza complex, and it was built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu, also known as Cheops. The pyramids at Giza are considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and are a testament to the engineering and architectural skills of the ancient Egyptians.
